dt: {bc}talk or opinion widely disseminated with no discernible source
{bc}a statement or report current without known authority for its truth
{bc}talk or report of a notable person or event

et: Middle English {it}rumour{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}rumor{/it} clamor, gossip; akin to Old English {it}rēon{/it} to lament, Sanskrit {it}rauti{/it} he roars
shortdef: talk or opinion widely disseminated with no discernible source
a statement or report current without known authority for its truth
talk or report of a notable person or event
to tell or spread by rumor

dt.t: {it}Rumors are flying{/it} that he'll be announcing his candidacy soon.
